(1) analyzing the limitations of applying current methods on finding linear correlations in data subsets;
(2) developing a novel algorithm to find multiple local linear correlations in data subsets. The basic idea is using a heuristic to construct hyperplanes that represent linear correlations;
(3) conducting extensive experiments to show that our algorithm is effective to find correct correlations in both synthetic and real-world datasets.
(1) Integrate user interests in our method to find interesting local linear correlations.
(2) developing a method that can guarantee to find all correct linear correlations in polynomial time complexity in each execution is a challenging work
